intro: Tetractomia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered tetractomia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Tetractomia parviflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
